summary: This is an email chain from June 25, 2020, discussing the coordination of victim notification procedures for the Epstein case between AUSAs, FBI Victim Services Division, and SDNY victim services. The plan involves phone notifications to a small group of statutory victims' attorneys and written notifications to a larger group of Epstein victims, with an emphasis on avoiding confusion and utilizing counsel representation.

persons.name: Program Manager FBI Victim Services Division
persons.context: Participant in email chain coordinating victim notification procedures; confirms sending out information later in the day.

events.title: Scheduled Victim Notification Coordination Call
events.description: A call is scheduled to discuss and finalize victim notification procedures for the Epstein case indictment, involving AUSAs, FBI Victim Services Division, and SDNY victim services.
personsInvolved: Program Manager FBI Victim Services Division

keyFacts: The document outlines a planned two-tier victim notification strategy: phone calls to attorneys representing a small group of statutory victims, and written letters only to a larger group of Epstein victims.
The notification plan is being coordinated in advance to ensure all parties (AUSAs, FBI VSD, SDNY victim services) are aligned, indicating a high-profile, sensitive case.
The majority of victims are noted as being represented by counsel, either in connection with the criminal case or civil litigation.
The email chain references the need to manage the VNS (Victim Notification System) database for the case, highlighting systematic procedural concerns.
